Package com.redis.foundation.app

Interface Task

All Superinterfaces:
Runnable
public interface Task extends Runnable
A Task is an interface that defines a collection of methods that the Application Manager will expect an application to implement in order to successfully run within its context.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Al Cole

    Once the task has completed its run, then this method will be invoked by the Application Manager to enable the task to release any resources it was holding.
    void
    test()
    Each task supports a method dedicated to testing or exercising a subset of application features without having to run the mainline thread of task logic.

    Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Runnable

    run

  • Method Details

    • getRunName

      String getRunName()
      Returns the name of the run task. This name will be used by the application manager to identify which task in the list to run (based on command line arguments).
      Returns:
      Name of the run task.

    • getTestName

      String getTestName()
      Returns the name of the test task. This name will be used by the application manager to identify which task in the list to test (based on command line arguments).
      Returns:
      Name of the test task.

    • isAlive

      boolean isAlive()
      Returns true if this task was properly initialized and is currently executing.
      Returns:
      true or false

    • init

      void init(AppCtx anAppCtx) throws FCException
      If this task is scheduled to be executed (e.g. its run/test name matches the command line arguments), then this method is guaranteed to be executed prior to the thread being started.
      Parameters:
      anAppCtx - Application manager instance.
      Throws:
      FCException - Application specific exception.

    • test

      void test() throws FCException
      Each task supports a method dedicated to testing or exercising a subset of application features without having to run the mainline thread of task logic.
      Throws:
      FCException - Application specific exception.

    • shutdown

      void shutdown()
      Once the task has completed its run, then this method will be invoked by the Application Manager to enable the task to release any resources it was holding.

      Note:If the JVM detects and external shutdown event (e.g. service is being stopped), then the Application Manager will asynchronously invoke this in hopes that the task can save its state prior to the process exiting.
